title: Share of male students achieving minimum proficiency in mathematics, by education level
subtitle: The share of children who achieve minimum [math](#dod:math-proficiency) proficiency at different education levels. At [primary](#dod:primary-education) level, students can demonstrate skills in number sense and computation, basic measurement, reading, interpreting, and constructing graphs, spatial orientation, and number patterns. At [lower secondary](#dod:lower-secondary-education) level, students can demonstrate skills in computation, application problems, matching tables and graphs, and making use of algebraic representations.
